text: The 1964 South Dakota gubernatorial election was held on November 3, 1964. Incumbent Republican Governor Archie M. Gubbrud did not run for re-election. Republican nominee Nils Boe defeated Democratic nominee John F. Lindley with 51.68% of the vote. ==Primary elections== Primary elections were held on June 2, 1964. ===Democratic primary=== ====Candidates==== *John F. Lindley, former Lieutenant Governor *Merton B. Tice, unsuccessful candidate for Democratic nomination for 1956 United States Senate election in South Dakota ====Results==== ===Republican primary=== ====Candidates==== *Nils Boe, incumbent Lieutenant Governor *Sigurd Anderson, former Governor ====Results==== ==General election== ===Candidates=== *John F. Lindley, Democratic *Nils Boe, Republican ===Results=== ==References== ==Bibliography== * * 1964 South Dakota Gubernatorial Category:November 1964 events
title: 1964 South Dakota gubernatorial election
